exercises.name: Alt Hamstring ISO Bridge
exercises.description: Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent at 90 degrees and feet flat on the ground. Lift your hips off the ground and hold the bridge position, engaging your glutes and hamstrings. From the bridge position, extend one leg straight out, keeping your hips level. Hold the extended position for a few seconds, then return the extended leg to the starting position and repeat with the other leg.
tips: Keep your hips level when extending one leg to maintain proper alignment
Drive through your heel of the grounded foot to maximize hamstring engagement
Engage your core to prevent your lower back from arching excessively
Hold the extended position for 2-3 seconds before switching legs

primary: Hamstrings
Glutes

exercises.name: Double Pogo Hop + Broad Jump
exercises.description: Start in a standing position with feet shoulder-width apart. Perform two quick pogo hops in place, focusing on staying on the balls of your feet and maintaining a slight bend in your knees. After the second pogo hop, immediately transition into a broad jump by driving both arms forward while extending your hips and knees to generate maximum horizontal distance. Land softly with bent knees to absorb the impact.
tips: Stay on the balls of your feet during pogo hops for quick ground contact
Use your arms to generate momentum for the broad jump
Land softly with bent knees to absorb impact and prepare for the next rep
Focus on maintaining rhythm between the pogo hops and broad jump

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes
Calves

exercises.name: Frankenstein Walk
exercises.description: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart. Step forward with one leg while simultaneously kicking your opposite leg straight out in front of you, keeping it as straight as possible. Reach your opposite hand toward your raised foot. Lower your leg and repeat on the other side, alternating as you walk forward. Keep your core engaged and maintain an upright posture throughout.
tips: Keep your kicking leg as straight as possible to maximize the hamstring stretch
Maintain an upright posture and avoid rounding your back
Reach toward your raised foot with the opposite hand for added stretch
Control the movement - avoid swinging your leg with momentum

primary: Hamstrings
Glutes

exercises.name: Hip Flexor Curls
exercises.description: Begin by lying on your back with your legs extended straight. Place your hands flat on the floor beside you for support. Engage your core and lift both legs slightly off the ground. Keeping your legs straight, slowly curl your knees toward your chest by contracting your hip flexors and abdominals. Pause briefly at the top, then extend your legs back to the starting position without letting them touch the ground.
tips: Keep your lower back pressed into the floor to protect your spine
Focus on using your hip flexors to initiate the curling motion
Control the movement throughout - avoid using momentum
Keep your legs elevated throughout the set to maintain tension

primary: Hip Flexors
Abdominals

exercises.name: Hip Flexor Rock Back
exercises.description: Start in a half-kneeling position with one knee on the ground and the other foot planted in front of you. Keep your torso upright and core engaged. Slowly rock your hips backward, sitting back toward your heel while keeping your spine neutral. Then rock forward into a hip flexor stretch, pushing your hips toward the front foot. Continue rocking back and forth in a controlled rhythm.
tips: Keep your torso upright throughout the movement
Engage your core to stabilize your pelvis
Move in a slow, controlled rhythm to maximize the stretch
Squeeze your glutes as you rock forward into the hip flexor stretch

primary: Hip Flexors
Quadriceps

exercises.name: Lateral High Knees
exercises.description: Begin in an athletic stance with feet shoulder-width apart. Move laterally while performing high knees, driving your knees up toward your chest with each step. Keep your core engaged and pump your arms in rhythm with your leg movement. Stay on the balls of your feet and maintain a quick tempo as you travel sideways.
tips: Stay on the balls of your feet for quick, agile movement
Drive your knees up high with each step to maximize hip flexor engagement
Keep your core engaged and maintain an athletic posture
Pump your arms in rhythm to help generate momentum

primary: Hip Flexors
Quadriceps

exercises.name: Lateral Hop Reactive Prep
exercises.description: Start in an athletic stance with knees slightly bent and core engaged. Perform a lateral hop to one side, landing softly on the outside foot. Immediately react and hop back to the other side, focusing on quick ground contact time. Keep your hips low and maintain balance throughout the movement, using your arms for counterbalance.
tips: Focus on quick ground contact time for reactive training
Land softly with bent knees to absorb impact
Keep your hips low and maintain an athletic posture
Use your arms for balance and to help generate power

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Lateral Monster Step
exercises.description: Start in a quarter squat position with feet shoulder-width apart and toes pointed slightly outward. Step laterally with one foot, maintaining the low squat position throughout. Bring the trailing leg to meet the stepping leg, keeping tension in the glutes and outer thighs. Continue stepping in the same direction for the prescribed distance, then repeat in the opposite direction.
tips: Stay low in the squat position throughout the movement
Keep your toes pointed slightly outward to engage the glutes
Maintain tension in your outer thighs and glutes with each step
Avoid letting your knees cave inward - keep them tracking over your toes

primary: Glutes
Abductors
Quadriceps

exercises.name: Linear Squat Hop
exercises.description: Begin in a squat position with feet shoulder-width apart and arms in front of you for balance. Explode upward and forward, jumping in a straight line while swinging your arms for momentum. Land softly in the squat position, absorbing the impact through your legs. Immediately transition into the next hop, maintaining a continuous rhythm.
tips: Land softly in the squat position to absorb impact and protect your joints
Use your arms to generate momentum for each hop
Keep your core engaged throughout for stability
Focus on both height and distance with each jump

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Plyo Push Up
exercises.description: Start in a standard push-up position with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower your chest toward the ground in a controlled manner. Explosively push through your hands, generating enough force to lift your hands off the ground. Land softly with slightly bent elbows and immediately lower into the next rep.
tips: Keep your core tight throughout to maintain a straight body line
Land softly with slightly bent elbows to absorb impact
Focus on explosive power through the chest and arms
Start with regular push-ups if you cannot generate enough force to lift off

primary: Chest
Triceps

exercises.name: S/L Plyo Box Jumps
exercises.description: Stand on one leg facing a plyo box at an appropriate height. Bend your standing knee and swing your arms back to prepare. Explosively drive through your standing leg while swinging your arms forward, jumping onto the box. Land softly on both feet on top of the box with bent knees. Step down carefully and repeat on the same leg before switching sides.
tips: Start with a lower box height and progress as your strength and confidence improve
Use your arms to help generate upward momentum
Land softly on top of the box with bent knees to absorb impact
Step down from the box rather than jumping down to protect your joints

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: S/L Toe Touch + Alt High Knee
exercises.description: Stand on one leg with your knee slightly bent for balance. Hinge at your hips and reach down to touch your standing foot toe with the opposite hand, extending your free leg behind you. Return to standing and immediately drive your non-standing knee up toward your chest in a high knee motion. Return to the starting position and repeat the sequence.
tips: Keep your standing leg slightly bent for better balance
Hinge at your hips rather than rounding your back when reaching for your toe
Drive your knee up powerfully during the high knee portion
Focus on balance and control throughout the movement

primary: Core
Hip Flexors

exercises.name: S/L Wall Reach RDL + Alt Knee Drive
exercises.description: Stand on one leg with your hand touching a wall for balance. Perform a single-leg RDL by hinging at your hips, extending your free leg behind you while reaching your free hand toward the ground. Return to standing and immediately drive your non-standing knee up toward your chest. Lower your leg and repeat the RDL to knee drive sequence.
tips: Use the wall lightly for balance, not to support your weight
Keep a slight bend in your standing knee throughout
Hinge at your hips and keep your back flat during the RDL portion
Drive your knee up powerfully to activate your hip flexors

primary: Hamstrings
Glutes

exercises.name: S/L Wall Thoracic Rotations
exercises.description: Stand sideways to a wall with your inside arm extended and palm flat against the wall at shoulder height. Keep your hips facing forward and feet planted. Rotate your torso away from the wall, opening up your chest and reaching your outside arm back. Return to the starting position and repeat. This movement focuses on thoracic spine mobility while keeping the lower body stable.
tips: Keep your hips facing forward throughout the rotation
Rotate from your mid-back, not your lower back
Follow your rotating hand with your eyes to increase the stretch
Move slowly and control the rotation to maximize mobility benefits

primary: Thoracic Spine
Shoulders

exercises.name: Shin Box Dab w/ Rotation
exercises.description: Sit on the floor in a 90/90 position with both knees bent at 90 degrees - one leg in front (external rotation) and one behind (internal rotation). Rotate your torso toward your front leg while reaching one hand to the ground for the "dab." Engage your core and rotate to the opposite side, transitioning your legs to the opposite 90/90 position. Continue alternating sides with controlled rotational movements.
tips: Keep your spine tall as you rotate through each position
Focus on smooth transitions between sides
Engage your core throughout to control the rotational movement
Move slowly to maximize hip mobility benefits

primary: Hip Flexors
Core

exercises.name: Step Through Upper Cut
exercises.description: Start in a split stance with one foot forward. As you step through with your back foot, simultaneously perform an uppercut punch with the same-side arm, rotating your hips and torso to generate power. Land in the opposite split stance and repeat on the other side. This movement combines lower body stepping with rotational upper body power.
tips: Rotate your hips and torso to generate power for the uppercut
Coordinate your step with your punch for fluid movement
Keep your core engaged throughout to transfer power from lower to upper body
Stay light on your feet and maintain an athletic stance

primary: Shoulders
Core

exercises.name: Thigh Pop Wall Drill
exercises.description: Stand facing a wall with your hands pressed against it at chest height, leaning slightly forward. Start with one knee raised to hip height. Explosively drive that knee down while simultaneously driving the opposite knee up to hip height. Continue alternating legs in a rapid, rhythmic motion while maintaining contact with the wall and keeping your core engaged.
tips: Maintain a slight forward lean into the wall throughout
Drive your knees up quickly and powerfully
Keep your core tight to maintain stability
Stay on the balls of your feet for quick ground contact

primary: Hip Flexors
Quadriceps

exercises.name: Walking Romanian Deadlift
exercises.description: Begin standing tall with feet hip-width apart. Step forward with one foot and immediately hinge at your hips, lowering your torso while extending your back leg behind you for balance. Keep your back flat and reach toward your standing foot. Drive through your standing heel to return to upright, then step forward with the opposite leg and repeat the RDL on that side. Continue alternating as you walk forward.
tips: Keep your back flat throughout the hinge movement
Maintain a slight bend in your standing knee
Hinge from your hips, not your lower back
Extend your back leg for counterbalance as you reach toward the ground

primary: Hamstrings
Glutes

exercises.name: BB Hip Thrust
exercises.description: Position your upper back against a bench with your feet flat on the floor, shoulder-width apart. Place a barbell across your hips, using a pad for comfort. Engage your core and drive through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top. Your body should form a straight line from shoulders to knees at the top position. Lower your hips back down with control and repeat.
tips: Keep your chin tucked and gaze forward throughout the movement
Drive through your heels to maximize glute activation
Squeeze your glutes hard at the top of each rep
Avoid hyperextending your lower back at the top position

primary: Glutes
Hamstrings

exercises.name: BB Hip Thrust ISO Hold
exercises.description: Set up as you would for a standard barbell hip thrust with your upper back against a bench and barbell across your hips. Drive through your heels to raise your hips, forming a straight line from shoulders to knees. Hold this top position for the prescribed time, maintaining maximum glute contraction throughout. Focus on keeping your core engaged and avoiding any sagging or hyperextension.
tips: Maintain constant tension in your glutes throughout the hold
Keep your core braced to protect your lower back
Breathe steadily - avoid holding your breath
Start with shorter hold times and progress as you build endurance

primary: Glutes
Hamstrings

exercises.name: Barbell RDL
exercises.description: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip in front of your thighs. Keeping your back flat and knees slightly bent, hinge at your hips and lower the barbell along your legs until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings. Keep the bar close to your body throughout. Engage your glutes and hamstrings to reverse the movement and return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top.
tips: Keep the barbell close to your legs throughout the entire movement
Maintain a flat back - avoid rounding your spine
Push your hips back rather than bending at the waist
Only lower as far as your hamstring flexibility allows

primary: Hamstrings
Glutes

exercises.name: DB RDL (Toes Elevated)
exercises.description: Stand with your toes elevated on a small plate or wedge, holding dumbbells in front of your thighs. This elevation shifts emphasis onto the hamstrings by increasing the stretch at the bottom. Keeping your back flat and knees slightly bent, hinge at your hips and lower the dumbbells along your legs. Return to standing by driving through your heels and squeezing your glutes at the top.
tips: The toe elevation increases the stretch on your hamstrings
Start with a small elevation and increase as flexibility improves
Keep the dumbbells close to your legs throughout
Maintain a flat back and avoid rounding at the bottom

primary: Hamstrings
Glutes

exercises.name: DB Split Stance RDL
exercises.description: Split stance RDL targeting hamstrings, glutes, and lower back with stability focus.

primary: Hamstrings
Glutes

exercises.name: DB Split Stance RDL (IR Focus) + Step Up
exercises.description: Compound exercise combining RDL with step up, focusing on hip internal rotation.

primary: Hamstrings
Glutes

exercises.name: KB Deadlift
exercises.description: Fundamental strength exercise targeting posterior chain with kettlebell.

primary: Hamstrings
Glutes

exercises.name: KB Deadlift Hop
exercises.description: Stand with feet hip-width apart with a kettlebell between your feet. Hinge at the hips and grasp the kettlebell with both hands. Drive through your heels, extending your hips and knees to lift the kettlebell. Once standing with the kettlebell at hip level, perform a small hop by pushing through the balls of your feet. Land softly with bent knees and immediately transition into the next rep by lowering the kettlebell with control.
tips: Keep your gaze forward and chest up throughout the exercise
Engage your core to avoid excessive arching or rounding of the back
Focus on the explosive lift and soft landing during the hop
Ensure movements are fluid - avoid pausing excessively between the deadlift and hop

primary: Hamstrings
Glutes

exercises.name: Landmine Sumo Deadlift
exercises.description: Place a barbell into a landmine attachment. Stand facing the landmine with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing out at 45 degrees. Squat down and grasp the end of the barbell with both hands. Keep your chest up and core engaged. Drive through your legs, extending hips and knees simultaneously while keeping the bar close to your body. Stand tall squeezing your glutes, then lower with control.
tips: Maintain a wide stance with toes pointing out at 45 degrees to engage inner thighs and glutes
Focus on pushing through your legs rather than pulling with your back
Keep your shoulders back and avoid rounding forward during the lift
Engage your core throughout to stabilize your spine

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: S/L Asst. RDL
exercises.description: Stand next to a stable object such as a wall or rack for support. Shift your weight onto one leg with a slight bend in the knee. Hinge at your hips, reaching forward while extending your free leg behind you for balance. Lower until you feel a stretch in your hamstring, lightly touching the support if needed. Engage your glutes and hamstrings to return to standing.
tips: Use the support object lightly for balance, not to carry your weight
Keep your standing knee slightly bent throughout the exercise
Maintain a neutral spine and avoid rounding your back
Focus on maintaining control and balance throughout the movement

primary: Hamstrings
Glutes

exercises.name: Seated KB Good Morning
exercises.description: Sit on a bench with feet flat on the floor, shoulder-width apart. Place a kettlebell on your upper back, holding it securely behind your neck. Keep your chest lifted and core engaged. Hinge at your hips, pushing your glutes back and leaning forward while maintaining the arch in your lower back. Lower until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, then engage your hamstrings and glutes to return to upright.
tips: Keep your neck relaxed - avoid straining while holding the kettlebell
Focus on maintaining a neutral spine throughout the exercise
Engage your core to protect your lower back
Control the movement - avoid sudden jerking or swinging motions

primary: Hamstrings
Lower Back

exercises.name: Staggered Stance Trap Bar DL (Velocity)
exercises.description: Position yourself in a trap bar with a staggered stance - one foot slightly ahead and one slightly behind. Grip the handles with both hands and keep your chest up with a neutral spine. Explosively drive through both feet, extending hips and knees to lift the bar with controlled speed and power. Focus on maintaining proper form while emphasizing velocity and explosiveness.
tips: Maintain a consistent breathing pattern - inhale during lowering, exhale during lifting
Focus on driving through the heels and midfoot to maximize power
Keep the trap bar close to your body throughout the movement
Alternate the staggered stance between sets to balance muscle engagement

primary: Hamstrings
Glutes

exercises.name: Trap Bar Deadlift
exercises.description: Stand in the center of a trap bar with feet hip-width apart. Bend down with a hip hinge and grasp the handles with an overhand grip. Keep your back straight, chest lifted, and core engaged. Drive through your heels, extending hips and knees simultaneously to lift the bar. Stand tall with hips fully extended, squeezing your glutes at the top. Lower the bar back down with control, hinging at the hips.
tips: Ensure the trap bar is centered and stable before lifting
Keep your gaze forward and maintain a neutral neck position
Drive through your heels and keep weight balanced evenly on both feet
Avoid excessive jerking or swinging - perform the lift in a controlled manner

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Trap Bar RDL
exercises.description: Stand inside the trap bar with feet hip-width apart and grip the handles with a neutral grip. Keep your back straight and core engaged. Hinge at the hips, pushing your glutes back and lowering the bar close to your legs while maintaining a slight knee bend. Lower until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings. Squeeze your glutes and hamstrings to return to standing, keeping the bar close throughout.
tips: Keep your gaze forward and chest up throughout the exercise
Engage your core to avoid excessive arching or rounding of the back
Maintain a slight bend in your knees, focusing on the hip hinge
Perform the exercise slowly and controlled, focusing on hamstring and glute contraction

primary: Hamstrings
Glutes

exercises.name: BB Back Squat
exercises.description: Classic compound exercise targeting quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.
tips: Keep your chest up and maintain a neutral spine throughout the movement
Push your knees out in line with your toes
Descend until your hip crease is below your knee (parallel or below)
Drive through your full foot, not just your heels

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: BB Box Squat
exercises.description: Squat variation using box for consistent depth and posterior chain emphasis.

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Bodyweight Goblet Squat
exercises.description: Fundamental squat for building strength and improving squat form.

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: DB Bulgarian Split Squat
exercises.description: Unilateral squat with rear foot elevated targeting quads and glutes.

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: DB Goblet Squat
exercises.description: Lower body exercise holding dumbbell at chest in goblet position.
tips: Hold the dumbbell close to your chest with elbows pointing down
Use your elbows to push your knees out at the bottom
Keep your torso as upright as possible throughout the movement
Great exercise for learning proper squat depth and mechanics

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: DB Goblet Squat (Heels Elevated)
exercises.description: Goblet squat with heels elevated emphasizing quadriceps and improving mobility.

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Dual KB Front Squat
exercises.description: Front squat using two kettlebells in rack position.

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: KB Offset Squat
exercises.description: Squat with kettlebell held on one side challenging core stability.

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Landmine Lateral Slides
exercises.description: Dynamic exercise targeting hips and thighs with lateral movement.

primary: Glutes
Abductors

exercises.name: Landmine Split Squat (Front Foot Elevated)
exercises.description: Set up a barbell in a landmine attachment. Stand facing away with your front foot elevated on a step and back foot behind you in a split stance. Hold the barbell at chest level. Lower into a split squat by bending both knees, keeping your front knee above your ankle. Press through your front foot to return to standing.
tips: Choose a challenging yet manageable weight for the barbell
Focus on maintaining an upright torso throughout the exercise
Ensure stability and control during the front foot elevation
Keep your core engaged to stabilize your spine

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Landmine Squat
exercises.description: Place a barbell in a landmine attachment. Stand facing the barbell with feet shoulder-width apart. Grasp the end of the barbell with both hands and hold it at chest level. Squat down by pushing your hips back and bending your knees, allowing the barbell to slide down your torso. Descend until thighs are parallel, then drive through your heels to return to standing.
tips: Keep your feet firmly planted and weight evenly distributed
Focus on pushing your hips back and maintaining a vertical torso
Engage your core to stabilize your spine and maintain balance
Avoid allowing your knees to collapse inward - keep them tracking over your toes

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Loaded Jump Squat
exercises.description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper back or dumbbells at your sides. Lower into a squat with your chest up and knees tracking over toes. Explode upward through your hips and knees, lifting off the ground. In mid-air, extend your hips and knees fully. Land softly with bent knees and immediately go into the next squat.
tips: Ensure proper squat form before adding the jumping component
Land with a slight bend in your knees to minimize impact on joints
Engage your core throughout the movement to maintain stability
Start with lighter weight and progress as you master the movement

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Poliquin Squat
exercises.description: Stand on a raised surface with your heels hanging off the edge, holding dumbbells at your sides. Shift your weight to one leg, lifting the other foot slightly off the platform with knee bent. Slowly lower the lifted leg, extending it straight and allowing the heel to touch the ground. Press through your standing heel to return to the starting position.
tips: Keep your core engaged throughout to enhance stability
Maintain a straight back and avoid excessive forward lean
Control the descent of the lifted leg to emphasize muscle engagement
Start with lighter weight to master the movement before progressing

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Squat Hold + DB Snap Shot
exercises.description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell at shoulder height with elbow bent at 90 degrees. Lower into a squat and hold the position with thighs parallel to ground. While holding the squat, extend the dumbbell from your shoulder in a quick snapping motion. Return the dumbbell to your shoulder and repeat the snap shot while maintaining the squat hold.
tips: Keep your core engaged and maintain a neutral spine during the squat hold
Ensure your knees stay in line with your toes
Focus on speed and control of the dumbbell snap shot
Use a weight that allows proper form throughout the exercise

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Squat Pry + Archer
exercises.description: Hold a weight at chest level and lower into a deep squat. From the bottom position, rotate your torso to one side while extending one arm upward toward the ceiling - this is the pry movement. Return to center, then extend the weight horizontally away from your chest like an archer drawing a bow. Return to the deep squat and repeat on the opposite side.
tips: Focus on maintaining stability and control throughout each phase
Engage your core to support your lower back and maintain alignment
Start with lighter weight to ensure proper form and technique
Keep your breathing steady and controlled throughout the exercise

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: TRX Squat
exercises.description: Stand facing the TRX anchor point, holding one handle in each hand with arms extended. Lean back slightly to create tension in the straps. With feet hip-width apart, lower into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back. Descend until thighs are parallel to the ground, then push through your heels to return to standing while keeping tension in the straps.
tips: Keep your feet grounded and weight evenly distributed
Maintain tension in the TRX straps throughout the movement
Keep your knees in line with your toes and avoid inward collapse
Use the TRX as support but rely on your legs to drive the movement

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Tempo Back Squat
exercises.description: Set up a barbell on a squat rack at shoulder height. Position it across your upper back and step back. With feet shoulder-width apart, lower in a controlled manner over 3-5 seconds until thighs are parallel. Pause briefly at the bottom to eliminate momentum. Drive through your heels to return to standing at a controlled pace.
tips: Keep your chest up and gaze forward to maintain proper posture
Engage your core throughout to support your lower back
Focus on even weight distribution across your feet
Use a weight that allows you to maintain control during the tempo descent

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Alternating Lateral Lunge
exercises.description: Begin standing with feet hip-width apart. Take a step to the side with your right foot, keeping your left foot in place with toes pointed forward. Lower your body by bending your right knee, pushing your hips back while keeping your left leg straight. Pause briefly, then push off the right foot to return to center. Repeat on the opposite side, alternating in a controlled manner.
tips: Keep your chest up and back straight throughout the movement
Push your hips back as you descend to maintain balance
Engage your core for stability during the lateral lunge
Focus on pushing through the heel of your lunging foot to return to center

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes
Adductors

exercises.name: Anterior Lunge + Step
exercises.description: Stand with feet hip-width apart. Step forward with your right foot into a lunge, ensuring your knee is directly above your ankle. Push off with your right foot, bringing it back to standing. Immediately lift your left knee toward your chest in a step-up motion, balancing on your right leg. Lower your left foot and step back into another lunge. Alternate legs throughout.
tips: Maintain a straight back and engage your core throughout the movement
Control the descent into the lunge to protect your knees
Use your arms for balance, swinging them naturally during the exercise
Focus on smooth transitions between the lunge and step-up portions

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: BB Walking Lunge
exercises.description: Position a barbell across your upper back, gripping it slightly wider than shoulder-width. Step forward with your right leg, lowering until both knees form 90-degree angles with your back knee just above the ground. Push through your front heel to stand, then step forward with your left leg into the next lunge. Continue alternating legs as you walk forward.
tips: Start with a light weight to ensure proper form and balance
Keep your core engaged and maintain a straight back throughout
Take long enough steps to ensure knees form 90-degree angles when lunging
Drive through your front heel to engage the working leg muscles

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: DB Drop Lunge + Step Up
exercises.description: Hold dumbbells at your sides and stand in front of a step or platform. Step back into a drop lunge with your right foot, lowering until your left knee is at 90 degrees. Push through your left heel to stand. Immediately step up onto the platform with your left foot, driving your right knee up toward your chest. Step down and repeat the sequence before switching legs.
tips: Keep your chest up and shoulders back throughout the exercise
Engage your core to avoid excessive leaning or arching
Ensure your front knee does not extend past your toes during the lunge
Perform slowly and controlled, focusing on leg muscle contraction

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: DB Explosive Lunge Row
exercises.description: Hold dumbbells at your sides and step forward into a lunge position. From the lunge, explosively push off your front foot while simultaneously rowing both dumbbells toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Land softly back in the lunge position. Perform the sequence on the opposite leg, alternating with each rep.
tips: Maintain a straight back and engage your core throughout
Keep movements controlled to avoid excessive strain on joints
Choose a weight that challenges you while allowing proper form
Coordinate the explosive push with the rowing motion for fluid movement

primary: Quadriceps
Lats
Glutes

exercises.name: DB KOT Lunge
exercises.description: Hold dumbbells at your sides and step forward with one foot. As you lower into the lunge, intentionally allow your front knee to track forward over your toes, emphasizing quadriceps engagement. Keep your torso upright and lower until your front thigh is parallel to the ground. Push through your front heel to return to standing, then repeat on the other side.
tips: Allow your knee to naturally track forward over your toes
Keep your core engaged and maintain an upright posture
Focus on pushing through your front heel to engage the working leg
Avoid excessive strain - maintain a comfortable range of motion

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: DB Reverse Lunge
exercises.description: Hold dumbbells at your sides and stand with feet hip-width apart. Step backward with one foot, landing on the ball of your foot. Lower your body by bending both knees until your back knee is just above the ground. Keep your torso upright and core engaged. Push through your front heel to return to standing, bringing your back foot forward to meet the front.
tips: Step back far enough to create a 90-degree angle with your front knee
Keep your front knee aligned with your ankle - avoid extending past your toes
Keep your upper body stable and avoid excessive leaning or twisting
Maintain a controlled pace and avoid rushing through the lunges

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: DB Step Through Lunge
exercises.description: Hold dumbbells at your sides and step forward into a lunge. As you lower, bend both knees until your back knee is just above the ground. Push through your front heel while simultaneously bringing your back foot forward and stepping through to the front position. Continue lunging forward, alternating legs with each step through.
tips: Keep your core engaged and maintain an upright posture
Step forward far enough to create 90-degree angles with both knees

exercises.name: KB Adductor Plank
exercises.description: Set up in a side plank position with a kettlebell placed between your feet. Squeeze the kettlebell between your ankles or lower legs, activating your adductors. Hold the side plank position with your hips lifted and body in a straight line. This dual engagement challenges both core stability and inner thigh strength.
tips: Keep your hips lifted and body in a straight line
Squeeze the kettlebell firmly between your legs throughout
Stack your shoulders and avoid letting your chest rotate down
Start without the kettlebell to master the side plank first

primary: Core
Adductors

exercises.name: Low Plank
exercises.description: Start face down with forearms on the floor, elbows directly under shoulders. Lift your body off the ground, forming a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core by drawing your belly button toward your spine. Keep your hips level - not sagging or piked up. Hold for the prescribed time while breathing steadily.
tips: Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels
Do not let your hips sag or pike up
Engage your glutes and quads to support the position
Breathe steadily throughout - do not hold your breath

primary: Core

exercises.name: Med Ball Reverse Crunch
exercises.description: Lie on your back with a medicine ball held between your knees or feet. Arms can be at your sides or holding something stable behind your head. Lift your legs and curl your pelvis toward your chest, lifting your hips off the ground. Lower with control and repeat, keeping tension on your lower abs throughout.
tips: Focus on curling your pelvis, not just lifting your legs
Keep the movement slow and controlled
Squeeze the medicine ball to keep it secure
Avoid using momentum - let your abs do the work

primary: Lower Abdominals

exercises.name: Reverse Crunch
exercises.description: Lie on your back with hands at your sides or under your lower back for support. Lift your legs with knees bent at 90 degrees. Contract your abs to curl your pelvis off the floor, bringing your knees toward your chest. Your hips should lift off the ground. Slowly lower back down and repeat.
tips: Focus on lifting your hips, not just bringing knees to chest
Move slowly and avoid using momentum
Keep your upper back pressed into the floor
Exhale as you curl up, inhale as you lower

primary: Lower Abdominals

exercises.name: Side Plank
exercises.description: Lie on your side with your forearm on the ground, elbow directly under your shoulder. Stack your feet or stagger them for stability. Lift your hips off the ground, creating a straight line from head to feet. Hold this position, keeping your hips lifted and core engaged. Switch sides and repeat.
tips: Keep your body in a straight line - do not let hips sag
Stack your shoulders and avoid rotating your chest toward the floor
Stagger your feet for more stability if needed
Breathe steadily throughout the hold

primary: Obliques

exercises.name: Tall Kneeling Slam
exercises.description: Kneel on both knees with a medicine ball held overhead. Keeping your core engaged, explosively slam the ball down in front of you, driving through your lats and abs. Catch the ball on the bounce (or pick it up), raise it overhead, and repeat. Maintain an upright torso and avoid hinging excessively at the hips.
tips: Use a slam ball designed to absorb impact
Generate power from your core, not just your arms
Keep your torso upright - avoid folding forward at the hips
Reset fully between reps with the ball overhead

primary: Core
Shoulders

exercises.name: Weighted Crunch
exercises.description: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell or weight plate at your chest or behind your head. Contract your abs to curl your shoulders off the ground, bringing your ribcage toward your pelvis. Keep your lower back pressed into the floor. Lower with control and repeat.
tips: Focus on curling your ribcage toward your pelvis
Keep your lower back pressed into the floor
Avoid pulling on your neck if holding weight behind your head
Exhale as you crunch up, inhale as you lower

primary: Rectus Abdominis

exercises.name: 10 x 10 Drill
exercises.description: Set up markers 10 yards apart. Sprint to the first marker, then jog back to start. Continue this pattern, sprinting out and jogging back for the prescribed number of reps. Focus on explosive acceleration during sprints and active recovery during jogs.
tips: Explode out of your start position on each sprint
Use the jog back as active recovery - stay light on your feet
Maintain good sprint mechanics: drive your knees, pump your arms
Keep rest periods consistent to build conditioning

primary: Quadriceps
Hamstrings

exercises.name: Assault Bike
exercises.description: Sit on an assault bike (air bike) and grip the handles. Push and pull with your arms while pedaling with your legs. The fan provides air resistance - the harder you work, the more resistance you encounter. Maintain a consistent cadence or perform intervals based on your program.
tips: Drive through your legs and pull/push with your arms simultaneously
Keep your core engaged to transfer power efficiently
For max efforts, stay seated and maintain aggressive arm action
Pace yourself for longer intervals - the bike will humble you

primary: Quadriceps
Hamstrings

exercises.name: Bounding Skips
exercises.description: Begin jogging, then transition into powerful skipping bounds. Drive one knee up high while pushing off explosively with the opposite foot. Emphasize height and distance with each bound. Swing your arms in opposition to your legs to generate momentum. Land softly and immediately drive into the next bound.
tips: Drive your knee up high and extend your hip fully on the push-off
Use your arms aggressively to generate momentum
Aim for both height and distance with each bound
Land with a soft, bent knee to absorb impact

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Carioca
exercises.description: Move laterally by crossing one foot in front of the other, then behind, in a continuous pattern. Rotate your hips with each crossover step while keeping your shoulders facing forward. Use your arms for balance and rhythm. Stay on the balls of your feet with quick, light steps.
tips: Keep your shoulders facing forward while your hips rotate
Stay light on the balls of your feet
Use your arms for balance and to help generate rhythm
Start slow to master the pattern, then increase speed

primary: Hip Flexors
Glutes

exercises.name: Fall In Sprint Start
exercises.description: Stand tall with feet together. Lean forward, allowing yourself to fall off balance. As you begin to fall, catch yourself by driving one leg forward into an explosive first step. Continue accelerating into a sprint. This drill teaches you to use gravity to initiate acceleration.
tips: Commit to the lean - you need to fall past your balance point
Drive your first step powerfully into the ground
Keep your body at a forward angle during initial acceleration
Pump your arms aggressively from the first step

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: High Knees
exercises.description: Run in place, driving your knees up toward your chest with each step. Stay on the balls of your feet with quick ground contact. Pump your arms in rhythm with your legs. Maintain an upright posture with your core engaged throughout.
tips: Drive your knees up to hip height or higher
Stay on the balls of your feet with quick ground contact
Keep your core tight and maintain upright posture
Pump your arms in coordination with your legs

primary: Hip Flexors
Quadriceps

exercises.name: Lateral Half Kneeling Sprint Start
exercises.description: Start in a half-kneeling position facing perpendicular to your intended direction. On the signal, drive off your front foot and push off your back knee, accelerating laterally. Drive your arms and transition into a full sprint in the lateral direction.
tips: Load your front leg before the start
Drive explosively off both the front foot and back knee
Keep your body low during the initial acceleration
Transition smoothly from lateral to full sprint mechanics

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Lateral Roll In Sprint Start
exercises.description: Start lying on your side. Roll toward your intended direction and use the momentum to drive up into a lateral sprint start. Push off the ground explosively and accelerate in the lateral direction. This drill trains reactive starts from unconventional positions.
tips: Use the rolling momentum to help generate initial drive
Get your feet under you quickly during the transition
Stay low and drive laterally during initial acceleration
Practice both directions for balanced development

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Lateral Sprint
exercises.description: From an athletic stance, push off explosively and sprint sideways, leading with the outside foot. Keep your hips low and shoulders level. Drive with your legs and use your arms for balance and power. Maintain a low athletic position throughout.
tips: Stay low in an athletic stance throughout
Push off explosively with the trailing leg
Keep your shoulders level and avoid leaning
Practice both directions equally

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Roll In Sprint Start
exercises.description: Start lying face down. Roll forward and use the momentum to drive up into a sprint start. As you come out of the roll, plant your feet and explode forward into acceleration. This drill trains reactive starts and the ability to generate power from unconventional positions.
tips: Commit to the roll and use the momentum
Get your feet planted quickly after the roll
Stay low and drive forward during initial acceleration
Focus on a powerful first step out of the roll

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes

exercises.name: Band OH Responsive Pull Apart
exercises.description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a resistance band overhead with both hands slightly wider than shoulder-width. Maintain an upright posture with a slight knee bend. Pull the band apart horizontally, squeezing your shoulder blades together. The "responsive" aspect comes from slowly controlling the return phase - resist letting the band snap back. Focus on slow, controlled movement in both directions.
tips: Start with light resistance and gradually increase as strength improves
Focus on quality over speed - slow and controlled reps are more effective
Keep shoulders down and away from ears for proper muscle activation
Aim for full range of motion, pulling until hands are comfortably wide

primary: Rear Deltoids
Upper Trapezius

exercises.name: Captain Morgan
exercises.description: Stand beside a wall with feet hip-width apart. Lift your right knee toward your chest creating a 90-degree angle at the hip. Externally rotate your right hip, allowing the knee to point to the side. Gently place the outer side of your knee against the wall. While keeping the knee on the wall, rotate your hip further to the right, creating a dynamic stretch. Hold and breathe, then slowly release and repeat on the other side.
tips: Perform the movement in a controlled manner, avoiding abrupt motions
Ensure the standing leg remains straight and grounded
Adjust distance from the wall to control stretch intensity
Add gentle rocking motion for dynamic variation

primary: Hip Flexors
External Rotators

exercises.name: Gym Angels
exercises.description: Lie on your back with arms extended straight overhead, palms facing each other, legs fully extended. Engage your core by pressing your lower back into the mat. Lift your arms off the ground with a slight elbow bend. Move your arms outward in a sweeping motion, opening to the sides while keeping them parallel to the ground. Continue until arms reach overhead in a wide "V" shape. Reverse the motion back to start.
tips: Maintain a relaxed neck and avoid unnecessary tension
Keep shoulder blades down and back throughout
Control the movement to prevent jerking or abrupt motions
Use light dumbbells optionally for added resistance

primary: Deltoids
Trapezius

exercises.name: KB Front Rack Walk
exercises.description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart with a kettlebell in each hand. Clean the kettlebells to front rack position with elbows bent and kettlebells close to shoulders. Maintain a firm grip with wrists straight. Brace your core and keep shoulders pulled back. Walk forward with controlled steps, maintaining the front rack position. Continue for set distance while keeping kettlebells secure and close to your chest.
tips: Start with manageable weight to ensure proper form and stability
Keep elbows close to body in front rack position
Focus on engaging your core throughout the walk
Walk backward for added balance and coordination challenge

primary: Core
Quadriceps
Shoulders

exercises.name: Kickstand Glute ISO
exercises.description: Stand with feet hip-width apart. Lift your right foot and position it 12-18 inches behind your left foot with toes touching the ground (kickstand position). Hinge at your hips, pushing them back while maintaining a slight bend in your left knee. Keep your back straight and chest lifted. Focus on engaging your left glute as you hold the hinge position. Push through your left heel to return to standing. Switch sides and repeat.
tips: Keep core engaged to stabilize your spine
Focus on the hip hinge to maximize glute engagement
Control the movement and avoid using momentum
Use as a warm-up or part of a glute-focused workout

primary: Gluteus Maximus

exercises.name: Kneeling Thoracic Wall Contour
exercises.description: Kneel on a mat with knees hip-width apart. Place hands on a wall at shoulder height with elbows slightly bent. Engage your core and initiate a gentle pelvic tilt by tucking your tailbone under. Slowly lean your hips forward while maintaining the pelvic tilt, allowing your upper back to curve toward the wall. Move your body in a contouring motion along the wall, tracing your thoracic spine curve. Reverse by moving hips back. Repeat with smooth, controlled movements.
tips: Start with small range of motion and gradually increase
Maintain stable and engaged core throughout
Breathe deeply to facilitate relaxation and enhance the stretch
Suitable for warm-ups or cool-downs

primary: Thoracic Spine

exercises.name: DB Hammer Shrug + Lateral Raise (Eccentric Focus)
exercises.description: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended by your sides, palms facing your body (hammer grip). Elevate your shoulders toward your ears in a shrugging motion. At the top of the shrug, hold and squeeze your traps. Slowly lower the dumbbells to the sides in a controlled manner, transitioning into a lateral raise. When arms are parallel to ground, pause and engage lateral deltoids. Lower back to starting hammer grip position. Repeat emphasizing the controlled eccentric phase.
tips: Maintain straight posture with slight knee bend to protect lower back
Control the lowering phase of lateral raise to maximize engagement
Use challenging weight while maintaining proper form
Focus on quality over quantity for proper muscle contraction

primary: Upper Trapezius
Lateral Deltoids

exercises.name: Med Ball Squat + Vertical Throw
exercises.description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a medicine ball at chest height. Initiate a squat by bending knees and hips, lowering down while keeping chest up and spine neutral. Explosively drive through your heels, extending hips and knees to return to standing. Use the power from the squat to propel the medicine ball vertically overhead. Throw for maximum height while maintaining control. Catch the ball as it descends by bending knees. Reset and repeat.
tips: Choose appropriate medicine ball weight for good form while challenging muscles
Engage core throughout to stabilize spine and transfer power
Focus on explosive upward movement using lower body and core
Develops lower body strength, power, and overall athleticism

primary: Quadriceps
Glutes
Core
Shoulders

exercises.name: S/A KB Front Rack Walk
exercises.description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart with a kettlebell beside you. Bend at knees and hips to grasp the kettlebell handle with one hand. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder, keeping elbow bent and close to body (front rack position). Tighten grip with wrist straight and aligned with forearm. Maintain neutral spine and engaged core. Walk forward with slow, deliberate steps focusing on balance and stability. Keep kettlebell close to chest with elbow forward. Complete set distance then switch arms.
tips: Keep core muscles engaged to stabilize spine and pelvis
Maintain kettlebell in front rack position with elbow close to body
Focus on maintaining firm grip throughout the movement
Avoid leaning backward or forward - maintain upright posture

primary: Core
Shoulders
Upper Back

exercises.name: Shoulder ER Abduction PAILS & RAILS
exercises.description: Lie on your side with bottom arm bent under your head for support, knees bent for stability. Hold a light dumbbell in top hand, palm up, elbow bent at 90 degrees. Slowly externally rotate your shoulder, moving the dumbbell upward. Hold the end range position. For PAILS: push the dumbbell against your hand with increasing effort for 10-15 seconds. For RAILS: relax and allow the resistance to gently pull your hand back while maintaining the position. Perform 1-2 rounds per side.
tips: Start with light resistance to ensure proper technique
Focus on maintaining proper posture and alignment
Breathe deeply and rhythmically throughout the movement
Gradually increase PAILS intensity over time as control improves

primary: Rotator Cuff
Deltoids

exercises.name: Shoulder Protocol
exercises.description: Three-part protocol: 1) Seated External Rotations - sit with dumbbells, pinch elbows to sides at 90 degrees, rotate shoulders externally. 2) Lateral Raises with External Rotation - seated, hold dumbbells at shoulder height, rotate shoulders to lift dumbbells overhead. 3) Prone Dumbbell Lifts - lie face down on bench, lift dumbbells straight above shoulder height with straight arms, then pull into chest by bending elbows. Repeat each part for desired reps.
tips: Use light dumbbells to focus on control and proper form
Keep core engaged to stabilize spine during exercises
Perform each movement with smooth, controlled motion
Targets all aspects of shoulder for comprehensive engagement

primary: Deltoids
Rotator Cuff

exercises.name: Sit Through + Crab Reach
exercises.description: Start in tabletop position with hands beneath shoulders and knees beneath hips. Lift right hand and kick right leg under body, extending it to the left side. Rotate torso left, opening chest toward ceiling with right arm pointing up. Transition to crab position by lifting hips toward ceiling while extending left arm overhead, reaching toward the right. Reverse by lowering hips, bringing right hand down, and retracting right leg. Repeat on other side, flowing smoothly between movements.
tips: Engage core throughout the entire movement for stability
Control the pace to ensure proper form and coordination
Keep breathing steady and controlled
Extend reaching arm further in crab position for deeper stretch

primary: Core
Shoulders
Hip Abductors

exercises.name: Spinal Roll + Scorpion
exercises.description: Start seated with legs extended in front. Slowly roll your spine down, one vertebra at a time, until lying on your back with legs straight and arms overhead. From supine position, bend right knee and bring it across your body toward the left side while rotating torso right, letting right foot hover above ground. Extend right arm in opposite direction, reaching toward right foot. Feel the stretch along spine, obliques, and outer hip. Return to center and repeat on other side. Flow smoothly between movements.
tips: Perform the movement slowly with control to maximize the stretch
Focus on breathing rhythmically throughout
Adapt range of motion based on your flexibility and comfort
Deepening reach during Scorpion intensifies the stretch

primary: Erector Spinae
Abdominals
Obliques

exercises.name: TRX High Pull + Press
exercises.description: Adjust TRX straps to mid-length. Stand facing anchor point with feet hip-width apart, holding one handle in each hand. Lean back with arms extended forward, then pull your body toward the handles keeping elbows high and engaging back muscles. At the top, transition smoothly into a press by straightening arms overhead, pressing handles away from chest. Lower body back down with control, bending elbows as you return to start. Repeat in fluid motion emphasizing control and stability.
tips: Ensure TRX straps are securely anchored
Adjust difficulty by changing body angle - steeper angle increases resistance
Focus on controlled and deliberate movement
Try single-arm variation for added stability challenge

primary: Deltoids
Latissimus Dorsi
Rhomboids

exercises.name: TRX S/A Row w/ Rotation
exercises.description: Adjust TRX straps to mid-length. Stand facing anchor point with feet shoulder-width apart, holding one TRX handle in your right hand. Start with arm extended, body leaning back creating tension in the strap. Initiate a row by pulling your right elbow straight back toward your ribcage, keeping elbow close to body. At top of row, rotate your torso to the right, opening chest and extending arm behind you. Your body should form a straight line. Reverse the motion and repeat. Switch sides.
tips: Maintain stable and engaged core throughout the movement
Control the rotation to avoid over-twisting the spine
Keep shoulder blades pulled back and down during the row
Adjust intensity by modifying body angle and TRX strap length
